lines.text: Candy, do you kiss with your eyes opened or closed?
Open, Honey, I don't want to miss anything.
Does this guy Candy Johnson bother you, my dear?
Not half as much as I bother him.
I'd like to stay in a place long enough to get my pants pressed.

[to Elizabeth about Candy]
You were going to change him, you said. You haven't changed him. He's changed you!
Yes, I may be a retired judge, but I'm a practicing drunkard.

[Entering the house with a group of toughs]
Where's your boss?
Mr. Johnson is dressing for dinner.
Tell him to slip on a kimono and come down!

[to Elizabeth]
You're prettier than a little white kitten with a blue ribbon on it.

[after telling Candy Elizabeth has lost the baby]
I'm gonna operate, but...
Operate? What are you talking about?
It's a long chance. You've got to understand that. I'll try... but I can't offer much help... any hope really.

[Glaring at Dr. Otis]
Don't tell me my wife is gonna die. I don't like talk like that.
Take hold of yourself, man. I'm doing my best, but I'm only human.

[In an ominous tone]
I'm not!
Light me.
I don't carry matches.
Maybe you oughta.
You know what happens to little boys who play with matches? They do funny things in the dark.
You know I ought to shoot you with your own gun. But I'm gonna let you do it yourself. We're gonna play a little game called committing suicide.
What's the rules?
One of us shoots himself.
And the other?
Laughs his sides off.
